text: 4 Second time I've been here. First time was whatever. This time it was actually good. Way better than inn n out. It's the same type of burger that's why I put it up against that. I love that you can get grilled jalapeños. Just wish they came on the burger and not on the side.
I love this place. The service is always good. I love the vegi burger and sweet potato fries. Worth the trip there. My #1 place to go in Boulder.

Sure, the public areas are still swanky, but things evolve all the time in Vegas. While the rooms themselves are fairly comfortable, they're nowhere near as luxe as, say, the Venetian/Palazzo or the Wynn/Encore. It's simply going to be a decent, comfortable experience.

As with many Vegas hotels, they charge an extortionary "resort fee," which ostensibly pays for things like wi-fi and fitness center usage that are standard at most non-Vegas hotels. Even then, you don't necessarily need the wi-fi if you have a cell phone plan with unlimited data and tethering, and you also don't necessarily need the fitness center since you'll be getting 2-3x your normal daily steps with all the endless walking that's required inside casinos and on the Strip. That having been said, the fitness center is quite nice and well-stocked.

If you're a guest, getting around the common areas of the hotel is also going to be a challenge as they're so crowded with tourists, and as the entrance to the guest rooms is buried at the rear of the casino (read: a somewhat long, crowded walk to any exit leading onto the Strip). If rates are decent here and include some sort of bonus (like a meal credit at MGM properties), then I'd stay here again. If rates are super out of line, however, than I wouldn't even bother.

Stopped by here today in search of one of those weighted eye masks (they didn't have any) but had not been in the store in a while. They renovated it and it is beautiful. Very clean and upscale looking with isles and isles of products. 

They have a onsite salon as well and do hair, nails ext. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all, its a great place to go for all you beauty needs!

I should have listened to the reviews. This place is highly unprofessional. 

My 1st, visit was great. Signed up for a package only needed 2 months, I was directed to cancel you have to email corporate 30 days in advance. I paid for a partial month then I was directed each month would automatically be pulled out. 

At this point I have now sent 4 emails to them with no response requesting a cancel. 

My 2nd visit I was recommended a lotion at 30% off for a holiday weekend special. She advised due to something I could use the lotion today but had to keep it at the store for another 2 days. Thought that was weird - but hey whatever. I went with it. Also, during my 2nd visit the 2 bulbs were out in the bed.  Lastly, I would out if I would have started my package 2 days later I would have got my following month for $1.00. That was highly disappointing. 

My 3rd visit I come in pick up my lotion no problem; however I decided to ask her what the full price of the lotion was...she provided me the price after tax...which was exactly what I paid. The girls behind the desk advised I would need to go through corporate for the difference. 

So far - this company is a mess. I can not believe they do not provide their front line with the proper tools to provide good customer service. 

Should you really trust a company that can not trust their staff to adjust a price by 30%? Or trust them to enter a cancelation. This baffles me.

Decent service -- waiter was good; the rest of the staff could've been quicker/friendlier for a slow Friday night. 3/5 

Roasted Vegetable flatbread was amazing! Very low sodium. Great vegetarian choice; next time I'll try to request no cheese on the other veg flatbread (it'll probably be excellent as well). 4.5/5

Five of us gathered for a Friday night dinner at Glutton.  Chef Bradley Manchester cooked for the table and just sent out dishes from the fall menu he wanted us to try.  We got:

Cayenne and cheddar pork rinds
Eggplant caponata with goat cheese toast
Brandade Rangoon with salt cod
Guanciale flatbread
Shaved Brussels sprouts salad
Beet salad
Japanese street corn
Prime flank steak
Gnocchi with pork cheek
Short rib cavatelli
Butternut squash agnolotti
Wood roasted chicken
Turkey and guanciale meatballs
Grilled bread
Maple and mascarpone cheesecake
Churros and hot chocolate
Caramel apple fritters
Caramel corn profiteroles

This restaurant is well named for the food can make one become a glutton if the food here is not consumed sparingly instead of a large order like ours.  Execution of the dishes was excellent.  There was nothing from the list that I didn't think was great.

Standouts--the Japanese street corn is a must get.  The shaved Brussels sprouts salad was superb and all four desserts were very good.  The gnocchi with pork cheek was sublime!

Service was excellent with fresh share plates and silverware being brought.  For a newer restaurant in DTLV, this is a standout among the ones I've been to.  One caveat--we had the gnocchi but that is not on the fall menu.  If it returns to the menu during another season, it's a must get!

Hakkasan has good resident DJ's like Calvin Harris, but the layout of the club is meant for people with bottle service. The dance floor is tiny, and there is pretty much nowhere to sit for people who don't have a table (unless you go to the Ling Ling Lounge, where it's basically empty). If you're able to get a table to let you pass by them to get to the little stage-ish part in front of the dance floor, you can stand there and get a great view. Still had a great time, but wouldn't come back.

I am really happy with our service from Narine.  She was great.  I am a celiac and I was nervous going to a sushi restaurant.   They have a gluten free menu! Narine was very nice and made sure to let the chefs know about my allergy.  I got the Pad Thai  and a yellowtail and scallion sushi roll.   You can taste the difference between regular sushi rolls and this one.  The rice was delicious and it tasted like steamed rice, which was great! Narine brought out the food to me and told me everything was safe for me to have and she brought me gluten free soy sauce!  I enjoyed my meal very much!

This review is in regard to Dr. Sepulveda

Horrible experience here, my husband went in with a head cold, sore throat and non-stop coughing (trickle in the throat) that kept him and I up all night for over a week.  The Dr. he saw treated him for a sinus infection and prescribed an antibiotic.  After 3 days on the antibiotic and not feeling any better, coughing as much or more AND diarrhea, my husband called the office and requested a different antibiotic.  He spoke to a nurse who relayed a message from the Dr. of "take Pepto Bismol".  What the heck?!  There are many antibiotics out there, why would you hesitate prescribing another that may not have these side effects and may have the patient feeling better, but instead say, let's bandaid the diarrhea with another OTC medicine??  What a lazy, answer - I was furious!

Today my husband is back in the same facility (a week later), feeling & sounding worse than he did a week ago.  His mucus is no longer clear.  He has not slept much in at least two nights because of the cough.  There is one other person in the waiting room with him, same symptoms, same story (been there a week ago and is no better, actually worse). This time he got 3 prescriptions, a different anitbiotic, a steroid and cough medicine (which you would've thought should've been prescribed initially).  

This Dr. is a waste of time and should be removed for his lack of care and laziness.  He has an arrogant, uncaring demeanor and no bedside manner AT ALL.  For lack of a better word, he's an ass.  People don't go to the Dr. because they are bored and want to hang out, they are miserable and need your help.  They don't want to come back in a week, they don't want to run to the toilet because of something you prescribed or take OTC medicines that don't work. If you're not in the mindset of helping patients feel better, then find another profession!
